title: Input-Output Hierarchical Equations Of Motion
authors: Mauro Cirio, Pengfei Liang, Neill Lambert
abstract:
We derive an extended version of the hierarchical equations of motion (HEOM)
to compute output physical properties of a bosonic environment, which is
allowed to be initially prepared at an earlier time in a non-Gaussian input
state and then non-perturbatively interact with a quantum system. While
spectral assumptions analogous to the ones used in the regular HEOM are imposed
to compute output bath observables, they are not required to model input
states, leading to time-dependent contributions to the equations. For a given
desired input state and output observable, the range of the indexes extending
the regular HEOM is, by construction, bounded. Overall, the aim of this
formalism is to take advantage of the efficiency of the HEOM framework to model
non-Gaussian input states and the dynamics of environmental observables in
bosonic, non-Markovian open quantum systems.
